@graph.name: Old Fashioned Chicken and Dumplings
@graph.description: Old Fashioned Chicken and Dumplings is a family favorite meal that is both comforting and delicious!

video.name: Chicken and Dumplings from Scratch
video.description:
Old Fashioned Chicken and Dumplings is a family favorite meal that is both comforting and delicious! This easy recipe is created from scratch including the tender dumplings and juicy chicken in an easy homemade broth.

This recipe starts with a whole chicken simmered to tender perfection with veggies and seasonings.  Simple dumplings made with pantry ingredients are simmered in the broth until plump and tender.  This is a family favorite that will be requested again and again!

recipeIngredient: bay leaf or a pinch of poultry seasoning (optional)
1 ¾ cups flour (plus extra for dusting)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine chicken, onion, carrots and celery in a large pot. Season to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine chicken, onion, carrots and celery in a large pot. Season to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chicken broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer covered 45-60 minutes or until chicken is tender. While broth is simmering, prepare dumplings below.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chicken broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer covered 45-60 minutes or until chicken is tender. While broth is simmering, prepare dumplings below.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove chicken and vegetables from broth. Discard skin and bones and chop remaining chicken, set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove chicken and vegetables from broth. Discard skin and bones and chop remaining chicken, set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Gently add dumplings to broth.  Simmer 15-20 minutes or until tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Gently add dumplings to broth.  Simmer 15-20 minutes or until tender.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir chicken (and vegetables if desired) into broth and cook about 2-3 minutes or until heated through.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir chicken (and vegetables if desired) into broth and cook about 2-3 minutes or until heated through.

itemListElement.text: Combine flour, baking powder, salt and shortening with a fork until shortening is mixed in.
itemListElement.name: Combine flour, baking powder, salt and shortening with a fork until shortening is mixed in.

itemListElement.text: Add milk a little at a time and mix until combined (you may not need all of it, you want a soft but not sticky dough).
itemListElement.name: Add milk a little at a time and mix until combined (you may not need all of it, you want a soft but not sticky dough).

itemListElement.text: Knead a few times on a floured surface until dough is smooth.
itemListElement.name: Knead a few times on a floured surface until dough is smooth.

itemListElement.text: Generously flour your surface and roll the dough out to ⅛″ thick. Cut dough into 1″ x 2″ strips.  Flour generously to avoid sticking.
itemListElement.name: Generously flour your surface and roll the dough out to ⅛″ thick. Cut dough into 1″ x 2″ strips.  Flour generously to avoid sticking.

itemListElement.text: Cook in broth as directed above.
itemListElement.name: Cook in broth as directed above.

itemListElement.text: In a small bowl combine 4 tablespoons cornstarch with 4 tablespoons water.
itemListElement.name: In a small bowl combine 4 tablespoons cornstarch with 4 tablespoons water.

itemListElement.text: Add to boiling broth a little bit at a time stirring to reach desired consistency.
itemListElement.name: Add to boiling broth a little bit at a time stirring to reach desired consistency.
